reviews.sentence: Business conference trip. The Renaissance Mid town is a few blocks further away from the World Congress Center but shuttle buses made this a non issue. It is a short distance from several restaurants and a Publix is a block away. The staff was super friendly and the hotel was extremely clean. What else could you ask for.

Perfection Was Needed and It Was Provided. This was my first stay at this hotel and it was chosen for it is location and reputation. This was not just a stay for me but I booked a block of rooms for a wedding party that included 30 rooms for two nights and some of the party arrived early in the week so more rooms were added. The original amount of rooms requested through the event planner was less so I had to add more to the block on more than once. The team of associates at this facility made it easy to make the increase even after our window of time on the agreement had passed. This was something that I found was consistent with how the team worked in every way to fulfill our needs in each and every way. This location the rooms lobby lounges and decor was over the top and very pleasing. I can not say enough about how much the team at this facility made this special event a great success. I will definitely return for business and pleasure in the future. Looking forward to the smiles we were greeted with from valet to food service.

Outstanding. Had business at Georgia Tech excellent location adjacent to campus within easy walking distance. Arrived at 1AM and was given a better reception than most hotels give at 1 PM. The service was outstanding throughout the entire stay. Great ambience in the lobby and well maintained room. Very affordable. Highly recommend both the hotel and the adjacent restaurant.

Nice place pretty convenient location. This hotel is within walking distance of the Midtown MARTA red line stop if you are the type of person who likes to avoid exorbitant taxi prices andor the inevitable gouging by rental car agencies and hotel parking garages. The main tourist stuff is not within walking distance from here so if you are looking to hit those centennial park sites on foot this may not be the place for you. It seems to be a more business friendly hotel. No pool. No frills. Just a nice modern room with all the amenities you will need for your convention stay. Staff was friendly and made a point to call me by my name. If you can find a price here for under 200 night you are getting a decent value. If your rate is higher than that you will probably be disappointed.
Nice hotel. Nice hotel close to GT a step above the conference center I have stayed at before.

Clean Hotel Nice Locale Good Service. Right away I knew the stay would be pleasant thanks to Mady at the front desk. She was smart and kind and remembered my name even though the hotel was packed. The room was comfortable nice bed and clean. Also the location in Midtown is great. lots of restaurants within walking distance. I ate lunch at the hotel and it was good. But for a really nice meal walk 12 a block to Eco.

Great stay. Stayed here while in town for a conference. The room was a good size with soft linens comfortable bed and a super plush robe. They offer my favorite Aveda bath products. it is convenient to MARTA rail and a terrific neighborhood. The rooms are much cozier than the Mariot Marquis or Century Center properties and I had definitely prefer to stay here given the option.

Great hotel great location great restaurant. The Renaissance Atlanta Midtown was a great place to stay close to the MARTA to get to convention center or out to Buckhead. The staff were very accommodating rooms very comfortable and nicely appointed and the restaurant Community Smith was so good. we did not want to eat anywhere else. Make sure you get a complimentary coffee before you head out was one of the best coffees I have had.

I truly enjoyed my stay the Renaissance Hotel. The hotels ambience was amazing. As soon as I walked through the door the building exuded positive energy. Everyone was smiling and ready to make your stay a pleasurable experience. The valet was very friendly and attentive. I always called in advance to let them know I was about to depart abd and my car was always waiting for me. There were so many venues within walking distance. The Renaissance did not disappoint and I will definitely be back. I would shout from the rooftop the rooftop bar that this is the best hotel to stay.

Great location being so adjacent to the Georgia Tech campus. Very modern hotel with top notch touches throughout. Good food options within walking distance. Staff could not have been better. Our stay at the Renaissance was a key part to the how successful and enjoyable our whirlwind family was.

Great hotel that feels as a small boutique hotel. Great midtown hotel feels as a small boutique hotel. Very nice people on the floor. Very helpful. Great breakfast menu no buffet. Rooms are specious. 15 minutes to Georgia World congress Center by Uber. Due to an event in town prices rises.

I normally do not care much for large hotels more of an AirBnb guy but the Renaissances unique interior decor really piqued my interest and eventually won me over. The lobby in particular has a disco pop vibe but at the same time is very accommodating. The staff was friendly and helpful when needed. The hotel bar does specials every week night in case you need to wind down after a long conference or something. And the rooms themselves are artful and clean. Location wise the place is smack dab in the middle of downtown near some great restaurants and bars in walking distance. Ubers are also easy to get in the area.
